content: I'm new to the forum, a disabled vet from OIF II. My brother is a 1LT in the Army National Guard. He is considering going active duty and enlisting. He has 14 years of active duty enlisted service, and a bunch more national guard service as an enlisted person, as well as an officer. He became an officer, went to Iraq, and is now back in the NG awaiting word on his promotion to CPT. If he doesn't get the promotion, is it possible for him to surrender his commission and go active duty enlisted? If so, what rank could he enlist at (he was an army SGT before he became a LT). From what I have read he can have no more than 14 years active duty to do this. Is this true? He's got 14 years going on his 15th year. Any help would be appreciated. Les
reply: I'm new to the forum, a disabled vet from OIF II. My brother is a 1LT in the Army National Guard. He is considering going active duty and enlisting. He has 14 years of active duty enlisted service, and a bunch more national guard service as an enlisted person, as well as an officer. He became an officer, went to Iraq, and is now back in the NG awaiting word on his promotion to CPT. If he doesn't get the promotion, is it possible for him to surrender his commission and go active duty enlisted? If so, what rank could he enlist at (he was an army SGT before he became a LT). From what I have read he can have no more than 14 years active duty to do this. Is this true? He's got 14 years going on his 15th year. Any help would be appreciated. Les
title: Recruitment Question

content: A follow up question: My brother is 45 years old. Would this make any difference? Thanks.
reply: A follow up question: My brother is 45 years old. Would this make any difference? Thanks.
title: Recruitment Question

content: I would think with your brother being eligible for Capt. that he would already know the answers to these questions and what enlisted rank he may be offered if he resigned his commission...... ya think? One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE
reply: I would think with your brother being eligible for Capt. that he would already know the answers to these questions and what enlisted rank he may be offered if he resigned his commission...... ya think? One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE
title: Recruitment Question

content: If he is already in, his age shouldn't make any difference! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!
reply: If he is already in, his age shouldn't make any difference! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!

content: You might want to ask your question here http://forums.military.com/eve/forums?a=corfrm&cf=4700002010001 You open with quote: I'm new to the forum, a disabled vet from OIF II. But, your profile says you are considering joining, You may want to update your profile. We wish your brother success. Keep us posted. God and the soldier, All men adore, In time of trouble, And no more; For when war is over, And all things righted, God is neglected - The old soldier slighted. Founding Member Original DVG & Proud Member, Rupterd Duck/Derelict Veterans
